comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Holy Smoke! Designed by Augustus Welby Northmore Pugin (1812–1852). "Former Presentation Convent, Slievekeale Road. Designed 1841, constructed 1842-63. Some fittings and furnishings after 1852 by Edward Welby Pugin. Traditional monastic layout around a quadrangular cloister. Some minor modifications but essentially intact, including rood screen. Conversion of the convent (a protected structure) to a health centre by Waterford firm DHB Architects completed in May 2009." From - www.puginfoundation.org/irish_buildings/ (down the page a little). The Rood Screen must be behind the photographer.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Yes the Pugin connection should generate a bit of interest. It sent me on a hugely enjoyable web surf of his work around England, Ireland and believe-it-or-not, Australia. Won't bore you with the details. Your map location is slightly off - a block to the west - Google Satellite - g.co/maps/6j2cf [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] The contemporary photo (and others in Fergal of Claddagh's photos) show all the details of the building. I particularly like his description - "Here there is a sense of being in a place with strength of stone, comfort of trees and beauty of light."

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Wonderful building which was sold some years ago when vocations to the religious order declined. The school still operates separately. Very sensitively converted to use as a health facility by a group of local medical people. Its called Waterford Health Park and is actually worth traveling to see. You can see some pics of the exterior as it now looks on www.whp.ie From a colouring point of view, extensive use is made of pitch pine timber in teh chapel interior..
